definition: a database system that is created for a single purpose and to answer a specific question. This is in contrast to database systems that are predefined and routinely processed
the process of designing and building an executable computer program for accomplishing a specific computing task. Languages include Java, Python, SQL, PHP, R, and C++, to name a few
the process of systematically applying statistical and/or logical technique to describe and illustrate, condense and recap, and evaluate data
the process of detecting and correcting (or removing) corrupt or inaccurate records from a dataset
the administrative process that includes acquiring, validating, storing, protecting, and processing required data to ensure the accessibility, reliability, and timeliness of the data for its users
an organized collection of data, generally stored and accessed electronically from a computer system
a structured  approach of communicating data insights that include a combination of data, visuals and narrative
a graphical representation of information and data using visual elements like charts, graphs, and maps
the process of collecting and reading data so that one can describe past behavior and characteristics, and predict future ones

the study of algorithms and statistical models that computer systems use to perform a specific task by relying on patterns and inference rather than explicit instructions. It is considered a subset of artificial intelligence
a database management system from Microsoft that combines the relational Microsoft Jet Database engine with a graphical user interface and software development tools
Structured Query Language- a language used to communicate with a database. It is the standard language for relational database management systems
a software used to produce interactive data visualization products focused on business intelligence
a business intelligence platform used to analyze data and create interactive data visualizations
a geographic information system for working with maps and geographic informatio
a general purpose programming language used to develop both desktop and web applications. Python is designed with features to facilitate data analysis and visualization

a programming language and free software environment predominately used in statistical analysis and data analytics. Shiny is an R package that makes it easy to build interactive web applications from R
